item.title: Web Application Testing Methodologies
item.description: Testing Modern Web Applications The modern web application is a mass of complex interwoven components neatly hidden away behind a clean and responsive user interface (UI). However, once you start unplugging the cords from the frontend framework the scope of the application becomes clear and the attack surface large. In a world where testers are increasingly short on time and/or daunted by the scope of vulnerabilities to test for how can we ensure coverage without forfeiting time?

item.title: Building A REST API
item.description: The Power Of REST APIs REST APIs are a way to conveniently abstract away application logic and reduce the load on front-end processing. This is achieved by engineering the API to return data in such a way that we can simply render it straight out onto the page without sorting or intensive manipulation. In this way we can achieve faster load times for web pages, and at the same time reduce the amount of JavaScript running in users browsers.

item.title: Projects
item.description: Loading ... import { Octokit } from "https://cdn.skypack.dev/@octokit/core"; const octokit = new Octokit(); (async function pullRepos(){ const excludedRepos = ["Angus-C-git", "insurance-management-system", "ipcalc", "freeCodeCamp", "first-contributions"]; const specials = ["LiveBreachTimeline"]; await octokit.request('GET /users/{username}/repos', { username: 'Angus-C-git', page: 1, per_page: 30 }).then(response = { let timeLine = document.getElementById("projects-timeline"); timeLine.innerHTML = ''; response.data.sort(function(a,b){ return new Date(b.created_at) - new Date(a.created_at); }); response.data.map(project = { if (!excludedRepos.includes(project.name)) timeLine.innerHTML += `${project.created_at.slice(0,7)} ${project.
